description: Berbers are a cavalry-focused civilization that excels in hit-and-run tactics and mobility.
dark_age: Start with 3 villagers and a scout.
Build a house and a mill near berries, and gather food with the villagers.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Build a stable and start producing scouts or spearmen, depending on the enemy's civilization.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 20-21 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 150-200 wood, and 150-200 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 4-5 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
feudal_age: Build additional stables and continue producing cavalry units.
Research the unique technology, Kasbah, for faster castle and Kasbah construction.
Build a market and blacksmith to upgrade cavalry and sell excess resources for gold.
Advance to Castle Age at around 27-28 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 600-800 wood, 500-600 gold, and 400-500 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 3-4 to gold, and 6-7 to stone.
castle_age: Build a castle and train camel riders or genitours, depending on the enemy's civilization.
Research the unique technology, Maghrabi Camels, for improved camel rider performance.
Build a second town center and start training villagers.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 35-36 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3500-4000 food, 2000-2500 wood, 1200-1500 gold, and 1200-1500 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 8-10 to gold, and 12-15 to stone.
imperial_age: Train cavalier or heavy camel riders and research Zealotry for improved cavalry performance.
Use camel riders or genitours to raid enemy villagers and disrupt their economy.
Research the unique technology, Maghrebi Archer, for improved genitour performance.
Assign 40-50 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 16-20 to gold, and 25-30 to stone.
